description.narrative: The project activities are informing, training, studying the human rights violations, and detection of cases of human rights violations. Human trafficking is an increasingly serious problem in Bangladesh. Large-scale human trafficking is taking place with in the country, and from Bangladesh India, Pakistan and the Middle East. The project's primary objective is to raise awareness of human trafficking. The most important is the expected impact on women's and children's increased awareness of the dangers of h uman trafficking. Human trafficking is an increasingly serious problem in Bangladesh. The primary target group of the project is people considering moving to another country living in Jessore district, especially women and children. The secondary target g roup is the victims of human traffic. In addition, various stakeholders: community-based organizations, labor authorities, the police - are a third of the target group. The project is implemented within the eights unions in Jessore district. Founded in 199 1, Rights Jessore is a specialized anti-trafficking work. It aims to prevent human trafficking through information and education, as well as to assist human trafficking victims by providing them legal assistance, as well as taking them to the shelters of t he co-operation organizations. The organization also offers rehabilitation to the victims and helps them to adjust back to their community.
